Tools / Community providers

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Feb 17 - Feb 23, 2025
entry.content:
Providers / Community providers

  • terraform-provider-minio (‚≠ê287) - Terraform provider for managing MinIO S3 buckets and IAM Users.
  • terraform-provider-proxmox (‚≠ê2.5k) - Terraform Proxmox provider.
  • terraform-provider-value (‚≠ê16) - Value Provider for Terraform.

Testing / Community providers

  • clarity (‚≠ê141) - A declarative test framework for Terraform for unit testing. üíÄ
  • kitchen-terraform (‚≠ê1.1k) - Provides a set of Test Kitchen plugins which enable a system to use Test Kitchen to converge a Terraform configuration and verify the resulting Terraform state with InSpec controls. üíÄ
  • rspec-terraform (‚≠ê92) - RSpec tests for your Terraform modules. üíÄ

Tools / Community providers

  • hcl2json (‚≠ê441) - Convert hcl2 to json.
  • hcledit (‚≠ê60) - Go package to edit HCL configuration
  • hq (‚≠ê5) - command-line HCL processor
  • pipeform (‚≠ê316) - Terraform runtime TUI
  • tfk8s (‚≠ê1k) - A tool for converting Kubernetes YAML manifests to Terraform HCL
  • threatcl (‚≠ê432) - Documenting your Threat Models with HCL
  • yj (‚≠ê1k) - CLI - Convert between YAML, TOML, JSON, and HCL. Preserves map order.

Libraries / IDE

  • hcl-rs (‚≠ê155) - HCL parsing and encoding libraries for rust with serde support
  • hcl4j (‚≠ê71) - HCL parser in Java
  • tree-sitter-hcl (‚≠ê114) - HCL grammar for tree-sitter

Editor Plugins / IDE

  • vim-hcl (‚≠ê140) - Syntax highlighting for HCL
  • Vim-Terraform (‚≠ê1.1k)
entry.summary: 18 awesome projects updated on Feb 17 - Feb 23, 2025

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jan 06 - Jan 12, 2025
entry.content:
Tools / Community providers

  • cf-terraforming (‚≠ê1.2k) A command line utility to facilitate terraforming your existing Cloudflare resources.
  • prettyplan (‚≠ê175) - Prettyplan (available online here) is a small tool to help you view large Terraform plans with ease. üëª
  • Speakeasy - Generate a terraform provider from an OpenAPI specification.
  • tenv (‚≠ê1.1k) - OpenTofu/Terraform/Terragrunt version manager.
  • tfmv (‚≠ê144) - Rename Terraform resources and generate moved blocks
  • tfprovidercheck (‚≠ê86) - CLI to prevent malicious Terraform Providers from being executed
entry.summary: 6 awesome projects updated on Jan 06 - Jan 12, 2025

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Nov 25 - Dec 01, 2024
entry.content:

  • tfocus (‚≠ê64) - tfocus is a super interactive tool for selecting and executing Terraform plan/apply on specific resources. Think of it as an "emergency tool" - not for everyday use.

Providers / Community providers

Tools / Community providers

  • library.tf - Library.tf is built and designed to not just provide you with all of the registry information for Terraform and OpenTofu but to provide all of the insights you need to make decisions. Quickly find modules or providers that are supported and maintained and not full of bugs.

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Apr 01 - Apr 07, 2024
entry.content:
Community Modules / Miscellaneous

  • segmentio/stack (‚≠ê2.1k) - Configures production infrastructure with AWS, Docker, and ECS. üíÄ

Providers / Hashicorp supported providers

  • terraform-provider-docker (‚≠ê132) - Provider for Docker. üíÄ

Providers / Vendor supported providers

  • terraform-provider-pingdom (‚≠ê120) - Provider to manage Pingdom resources. üíÄ
  • terraform-provider-secrethub (‚≠ê49) - Provider for SecretHub. üíÄ

Testing / Community providers

  • terraform_validate (‚≠ê257) - Assists in the enforcement of user-defined standards in Terraform. üíÄ

Tools / Community providers

  • coretech/terrafile (‚≠ê140) - Systematically manage external modules from Github for use in Terraform (written in Go). üíÄ
  • driftctl (‚≠ê2.6k) - Detect, track, and alert on infrastructure drift üíÄ
  • gaia (‚≠ê1k) - Gaia is a Terraform üåç UI for your modules, and self-service infrastructure üë®‚Äçüíª. üíÄ
  • layerform (‚≠ê1.2k) - Layerform helps engineers create reusable environment stacks using plain .tf files. Ideal for multiple "staging" environments. üíÄ
  • pretf (‚≠ê105) - drop-in Terraform wrapper that generates Terraform configuration with Python. See pretf documentation üíÄ
  • scenery (‚≠ê365) - Another Terraform plan output prettifier. üëª üíÄ
  • terraform.py (‚≠ê452) - Ansible dynamic inventory script for parsing Terraform state files. üíÄ
  • terraforming (‚≠ê4.3k) - Export existing AWS resources to Terraform style (tf, tfstate). Similar to terraformer. üíÄ
  • terraformize (‚≠ê155) - Apply\Destroy Terraform modules via a simple REST API endpoint. üíÄ
  • xterrafile (‚≠ê66) Systematically manage external modules from the module registry, git, or local directories for use in Terraform (written in Go). üíÄ

Libraries / IDE

  • rhcl (‚≠ê15) - Pure Ruby HCL parser üíÄ

Self-hosted Terraform Platforms / IDE

  • Lynx (‚≠ê348) - Fast, Secure and Reliable Terraform Backend. It has a user-friendly dashboard, project and environment management, state versioning, locking and snapshots support.
  • OTF (‚≠ê571) - Open Terraforming Framework, an open source alternative to Terraform Enterprise with full Terraform CLI integration. üíÄ
entry.summary: 18 awesome projects updated on Apr 01 - Apr 07, 2024

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jan 22 - Jan 28, 2024
entry.content:
Managed Registries / Miscellaneous

  • cloudsmith - Managed package hoster for internal and external clients. üí≤

Managed Terraform Platforms üí≤ / IDE

  • Scalr - Alternative to Terraform Enterprise with OPA integration, organizational structure, custom hooks, native integrations with other DevOps platforms, and centralized reporting. üí≤
  • env0 - Alternative to Terraform Cloud/Enterprise with OPA integration, custom flows and Terragrunt support üí≤
  • Brainboard - Visually Design, Deploy & Manage modern cloud infrastructures starting from any Cloud Provider - AWS, GCP, Azure üí≤
  • Spacelift - Alternative to Terraform Cloud/Enterprise. Collaborative Infrastructure Delivery Platform for Terraform üí≤

Terraform Enterprise Tooling / IDE

  • terraform-enterprise-cli (‚≠ê12) - Terraform Enterprise Command Line Interface.
  • terraform-enterprise-client (‚≠ê8) - Terraform Enterprise API Ruby Client and Command Line tool.
  • terraform-enterprise-migrator (‚≠ê13) - Script for migrating Terraform Enterprise environments from Legacy to new version of Terraform Enterprise.
  • tfe-state-explorer (‚≠ê18) - Simple shell for exploring remote terraform enterprise state, with autocomplete. üíÄ
entry.summary: 9 awesome projects updated on Jan 22 - Jan 28, 2024

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jan 08 - Jan 14, 2024
entry.content:
Official Resources

  • Introduction to Terraform
  • Terraform Documentation
  • Terraform learn

Community

  • weekly.tf - Terraform Weekly Newsletter - Various news in the Terraform world (projects, announcements, discussions).

Books

  • Patterns and Practices for Infrastructure as Code: With examples in Python and Terraform

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Beginner Guides

  • A Comprehensive Guide to Terraform - Series of blog posts from the author of "Terraform: Up & Running" that guide the reader from beginning with Terraform to using it in the real world.

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Writing Custom Providers

  • Creating custom terraform providers - Guide for creating custom providers.
  • Writing Custom Providers - Official documentation for creating custom providers.

Tutorials and Blog Posts / How-To

  • How To Write OPA for Terraform - How to use Open Policy Agent to evaluate and enforce policy on your Terraform plans
  • Terraforming 1Password - How 1Password migrated from CloudFormation to Terraform.

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Google Cloud

  • Managing infrastructure as code with Terraform, Cloud Build, and GitOps - Setup and manage infrastructure as code with Terraform, Cloud Build, and GitOps.
  • Getting started with Terraform on Google Cloud - Using Terraform to create a VM in Google Cloud and Starting a basic Python Flask server.
  • Managing Cloud Infrastructure with Terraform - Deploy Kubernetes Load Balancer Service with Terraform, HTTPS Content-Based Load Balancer with Terraform, Modular Load Balancing with Terraform - Regional Load Balancer, Custom Providers with Terraform, Cloud SQL with Terraform, Building a VPN Between Google Cloud and AWS with Terraform.
  • Hashicorp Terraform Tutorials for Google Cloud - Get started with Terraform on Google Cloud.

Community Modules / Miscellaneous

  • terraform-aws-account-lookup (‚≠ê4) - This Terraform module allows querying AWS accounts and outputs the accounts in various mappings or as a complete list, with the ability to apply a search filter to the account list and group the accounts by existing tags using a submodule.
  • terraform-aws-appconfig (‚≠ê28) - Creates AWS AppConfig resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-datadog-forwarders (‚≠ê61) - Creates resources on AWS to forward logs/metrics to Datadog.
  • terraform-aws-dms (‚≠ê69) - Creates AWS DMS (Database Migration Service) resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-jenkins (‚≠ê256) - Build a Docker image with Jenkins, saves it to an ECR repo, and deploys it to Elastic Beanstalk running a Docker stack.
  • terraform-aws-managed-service-prometheus (‚≠ê31) - Creates AWS Managed Service for Prometheus (AMP) resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-msk-kafka-cluster (‚≠ê61) - Creates AWS MSK (Managed Streaming for Kafka) resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-rds-proxy (‚≠ê60) - Creates AWS RDS Proxy resources on AWS.
  • terraform-digitalocean-droplet - Terraform module for managing DigitalOcean Droplets and related resources.
  • terraform-linode-k8s - Installs Kubernetes on Linode Instances.

Self-Hosted Registries / Miscellaneous

  • boring-registry (‚≠ê209) - Private Terraform Module/Provider Registry with API key authentication and blob storage support

Providers / Vendor supported providers

  • terraform-provider-dominos (‚≠ê1.2k) - Provider for Dominos Pizza.
  • terraform-provider-scalr (‚≠ê19) - Provider for Scalr
  • terraform-provider-snowflake (‚≠ê619) - Provider for Snowflake data warehouse.

Tools / Community providers

  • Argonaut - Deploy apps and infrastructure on your cloud in minutes. Autogenerate Terraform modules, customize configurations through PRs. Support for app deployments on Kubernetes and Lambda environments.
  • terraform-bundle (‚≠ê46k) - Easily builds bundles containing a Terraform binary as well as provider binaries. Useful for CI and air-gapped Terraform Enterprise.
  • terraform-operator (‚≠ê377) - A Kubernetes CRD to handle Terraform operations.
  • terrahub (‚≠ê225) - TerraHub is terraform automation and orchestration tool. Seamlessly integrated into console.terrahub.io, enterprise friendly GUI to show realtime terraform executions, as well as auditing and reporting capabilities for historical terraform runs. üí≤
  • terramate (‚≠ê3.4k) - Tool for managing multiple Terraform stacks that comes with support for change detection and code generation
  • terrascan (‚≠ê5k) - Collection of security and best practice test for static code analysis of terraform templates
  • tfautomv (‚≠ê815) - Generate Terraform moved blocks automatically for painless refactoring
  • tfmask (‚≠ê204) - Terraform utility to mask select output from terraform plan and terraform apply
  • tgf (‚≠ê107) - Terragrunt frontend for executing Terragrunt/Terraform through Docker.

Videos / IDE

  • Orchestrating Containers with Terraform and Consul - Mitchell Hashimoto shows how Terraform can be used to deploy and scale containerized workloads.

Editor Plugins / IDE

  • Emacs terraform-mode (‚≠ê233)
  • Intellij
  • VS Code
entry.summary: 41 awesome projects updated on Jan 08 - Jan 14, 2024

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Writing Custom Providers

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Aug 28 - Sep 03, 2023
entry.content:
Self-Hosted Registries / Miscellaneous

  • citizen (‚≠ê641) - Private Terraform Module/Provider Registry
  • nrkno/terraform-registry (‚≠ê109) - A private Terraform registry with modular store backends.
  • petra (‚≠ê44) - Private Terraform Registry Manager
  • philips-labs/terraform-registry (‚≠ê96) - Terraform registry to serve arbitrary Terraform provider releases hosted on Github
  • tapir (‚≠ê223) - Private Terraform Registry.
  • terraform-simple-registry (‚≠ê68) - Simple implementation of the Terraform registry protocols.
  • Terrareg (‚≠ê303) - Terraform module registry.

Providers / Community providers

  • terraform-provider-docker (‚≠ê713) - Terraform Docker provider.
  • terraform-provider-terracurl (‚≠ê147) - Provider to make managed and unmanaged API calls to your target endpoint.

Tools / Community providers

  • balcony - CLI tool for easy AWS API reads. Also generates Terraform import-blocks, and actual Terraform Resource code.
  • burrito - Burrito is a TACoS (Terraform Automation Collaboration Software) Kubernetes Operator.
  • cfnctl (‚≠ê136) - Cfnctl brings the Terraform cli experience to AWS Cloudformation.
  • dxw/terrafile (‚≠ê2) - Systematically manage external modules from Github for use in Terraform (written in Ruby).
  • pytest-terraform (‚≠ê58) - pytest terraform plugin with fixtures and offline replay support.
  • renovate-config (‚≠ê50) - Sharable Config Presets for Renovatebot, especially useful for DevOps folks.
  • stacks (‚≠ê182) - Stacks, the Terraform code pre-processor
  • terracove - Recursively test a directory tree for Terraform diffs and coverage.
  • terraeasy (‚≠ê35) - Easy Terraform wrapper
  • terraform-cleaner (‚≠ê178) - Tiny utility which detects unused variables in your terraform modules.
  • terramagic (‚≠ê47) - Wizard tool for create folders and terraform files automated, written in Python !
  • terrap-cli (‚≠ê67) - Terrap - a powerful CLI tool that scans your infrastructure and identifies any required changes.
  • terrars (‚≠ê109) - Terrars is a tool for building Terraform stacks in Rust. This is an alternative to the CDK.
  • terrascope (‚≠ê29) - Build orchestrator for terraform monorepos.
  • terrashine - Terrashine is a terraform provider mirror1 implementation that works by automatically caching dependencies as providers are requested.
  • tfgen (‚≠ê87) - Terraform code generator for consistent codebase and DRY.
  • tfrepl (‚≠ê32) - A Terraform REPL, giving you a full shell experience. Readline based. No dependencies. Save config changes. History.
  • tfsort (‚≠ê222) - CLI utility to sort Terraform variables and outputs.
  • travelgrunt (‚≠ê69) - cd inside [mono]repos without fatigue!

Tools / CI

  • setup-terraform (‚≠ê1.5k) - Sets up Terraform CLI in your GitHub Actions workflow.
  • terraform-plan (‚≠ê64) - GitHub Action to run Terraform plan and add a comment with the changes.

Tools / IDE

  • vscode-terraform-live-graph (‚≠ê240) - Terraform Live Graph Extension for Visual Studio Code is a plugin that allows you to generate a live Terraform graph as you code.
entry.summary: 31 awesome projects updated on Aug 28 - Sep 03, 2023

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jul 31 - Aug 06, 2023
entry.content:
Community Modules / Miscellaneous

  • terraform-kubestack (‚≠ê692) - Kubestack is a framework for Kubernetes platform engineering teams to define the entire cloud native stack in one Terraform code base and continuously evolve the platform safely through GitOps.
  • terraform-nixos (‚≠ê369) - A set of Terraform modules that are designed to deploy NixOS.
  • typhoon (‚≠ê2k) - Minimal and free Kubernetes distribution with Terraform.

Tools / Community providers

  • terraform-aws-clickops-notifier (‚≠ê319) - Get notified when actions are taken in the AWS Console.
entry.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Jul 31 - Aug 06, 2023

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jul 24 - Jul 30, 2023
entry.content:
Community Modules / Miscellaneous

  • terraform-aws-lambda (‚≠ê995) - Terraform module, which builds dependencies and packages, and also creates AWS Lambda resources in countless combinations.
  • terraform-aws-rds (‚≠ê937) - Creates RDS resources on AWS (verified module).
  • terraform-aws-s3-bucket (‚≠ê557) - Creates S3 bucket resources on AWS.

Providers / Vendor supported providers

  • terraform-provider-iterative (‚≠ê295) - Terraform plugin built with machine learning in mind.

Testing / Community providers

  • terraform-compliance (‚≠ê1.4k) - BDD Testing for Terraform Files.

Tools / Community providers

  • atmos (‚≠ê1.1k) - A universal tool that converts deep merged YAML to module inputs. üëΩ
  • k2tf (‚≠ê1.2k) - Kubernetes YAML to Terraform HCL converter.
  • KICS (‚≠ê2.4k) - Scans IaC projects for security vulnerabilities, compliance issues, and infrastructure misconfiguration. Currently working with Terraform projects, Kubernetes manifests, Dockerfiles, AWS CloudFormation Templates, and Ansible playbooks.
  • pike (‚≠ê730) - Pike calculates the permissions or IAM policy required to build your Terraform.
  • python-terrafile (‚≠ê38) - Systematically manage external modules from Github for use in Terraform.
  • terraform-iam-policy-validator (‚≠ê338) - CLI validates AWS IAM Policies in a Terraform template against AWS IAM best practices.
  • Terraform-Visual (‚≠ê639) - A simple but powerful tool to visualize Terraform plan.
  • terragrunt (‚≠ê8.8k) - Terragrunt is a thin wrapper for Terraform that provides extra tools for keeping your Terraform configurations DRY, working with multiple Terraform modules, and managing remote state.
  • tfmake (‚≠ê26) - Automating Terraform with the power of make.
  • tfsec (‚≠ê6.9k) - Terraform static analysis tool that supports terraform <0.12 & >=0.12 & directly integrates with HCL parser for better results.
  • tftree (‚≠ê154) - Display your Terraform module call stack in your terminal.
  • tftui (‚≠ê1.2k) - A textual user interface for Terraform state.
  • tfvaultenv (‚≠ê47) - tfvaultenv reads secrets from HashiCorp Vault and outputs environment variables for various Terraform providers with those secrets.

Libraries / IDE

  • nu_plugin_hcl (‚≠ê8) - HCL parser plugin for Nushell (‚≠ê36k)
entry.summary: 19 awesome projects updated on Jul 24 - Jul 30, 2023

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jul 17 - Jul 23, 2023
entry.content:
Tools / Community providers

  • terragrunt-atlantis-config (‚≠ê698) - Generate Atlantis config for Terragrunt projects.

Self-hosted Terraform Platforms / IDE

  • cloud-concierge (‚≠ê236) - Open Source, codify unmanaged resources as Terraform, detect drift, and cloud cost and security analysis, delivered as a Pull Request.
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Jul 17 - Jul 23, 2023

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jul 03 - Jul 09, 2023
entry.content:
Community

  • Terraform Twitter Community

Tools / Community providers

  • tfgpt (‚≠ê73) - A CLI tool that integrates Terraform with OpenAI's GPT-3.5 Turbo to provide explanations for Terraform commands and concepts.
  • tfvar (‚≠ê222) - tfvar scans your Terraform configurations or modules and extracts the variables into formats of your choice (tfvar, environment variables, etc.) for editing.
entry.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Jul 03 - Jul 09, 2023

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jun 19 - Jun 25, 2023
entry.content:

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on May 15 - May 21, 2023
entry.content:
Community Modules / Miscellaneous

  • terraform-aws-atlantis (‚≠ê539) - Creates Terraform configurations for running Atlantis on AWS Fargate. Github, Gitlab, and BitBucket are supported.
  • terraform-aws-jenkins-ha-agents (‚≠ê8) - EC2 Based Jenkins deployment with HA (spot) agents. Runs on EFS for immutability. Fully customizable, with sensible defaults.
  • terraform-aws-notify-slack (‚≠ê484) - Creates SNS topic and Lambda function, which sends notifications to Slack.

Tools / Community providers

  • fuzzy-terraform-rm (‚≠ê37) - A fuzzy-finder command-line tool for removing resources from terraform state.
  • para (‚≠ê58) - The missing 3rd-party plugin manager and a "Swiss army knife" for Terraform/Terragrunt - just 1 tool to facilitate all workflows. üíÄ
  • yor (‚≠ê891) - Automatically tag and trace infrastructure as code frameworks (Terraform, Cloudformation, and Serverless).

Boilerplates / IDE

  • Terraform GitOps Framework - Everything you need to build reliable automation for AKS, EKS, and GKE Kubernetes clusters in one free and open-source framework.

Self-hosted Terraform Platforms / IDE

  • Digger - Open Source Alternative to Terraform Cloud - Run Terraform plan & apply jobs in your CI.

Videos / IDE

  • How to Build Reusable, Composable, Battle tested Terraform Modules - Yevgeniy Brikman talks about how to write Terraform code so that it is reusable, composable and testable. The presentation focuses on Terraform modules but also provides a brief and clear explanation of what problem Terraform was created to solve and a short demo of Terraform basics (~39 min, October 2017).
  • Setup Continuous Integration for a Terraform module - Example of using CI with Kitchen-Terraform to test, tag and publish our Terraform module, which creates a Google Compute Instance.
entry.summary: 10 awesome projects updated on May 15 - May 21, 2023

entry.content:
Tools / Community providers

  • Styra Declarative Authorization Service (DAS) - Provides a managed Open Policy Agent (OPA) platform for Application and Infrastructure use cases, including Terraform, Terraform Cloud, and Kubernetes. Enforce policy guardrails during development, in CI/CD pipelines, and at deploy time. Styra DAS Free provides multiple systems and users, policy impact analysis, decision logging and replay, and access to Styra's Terraform policy library.

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Dec 27 - Jan 02, 2021
entry.content:
Community Modules / Miscellaneous

  • terraform-aws-alb (‚≠ê453) - Creates Application load-balancer on AWS (verified module).
  • terraform-aws-customer-gateway (‚≠ê20) - Creates Customer Gateway on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-dynamodb-table (‚≠ê114) - Creates DynamoDB table on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-ec2-instance (‚≠ê785) - Creates EC2 instances on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-ecs (‚≠ê623) - Creates AWS ECS resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-elb (‚≠ê149) - Creates Elastic load-balancer on AWS (verified module).
  • terraform-aws-eventbridge (‚≠ê150) - Creates EventBridge resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-rds-aurora (‚≠ê400) - Creates RDS Aurora cluster resources on AWS (verified module).
  • terraform-aws-redshift (‚≠ê88) - Creates Redshift resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-route53 (‚≠ê139) - Creates Route53 resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-transit-gateway (‚≠ê158) - Creates Transit Gateway resources on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-vpn-gateway (‚≠ê116) - Creates VPN gateway resources on AWS.

Tools / Community providers

  • modules.tf-lambda (‚≠ê353) - Infrastructure as code generator from visual diagrams created with Cloudcraft.co to Terraform.

Videos / IDE

  • Your Weekly Dose of Terraform - YouTube channel with weekly live streams covering Terraform news, reviews, interviews, Q&A, live coding, and some hacking with Terraform.
  • Test and verify a Google Compute Instance with Kitchen-Terraform - Example of using Kitchen-Terraform to test our Terraform code that creates a Google Compute.

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Dec 14 - Dec 20, 2020
entry.content:
Legend

  • Not compatible with terraform >= 0.12 üëª
  • Abandoned üíÄ
  • Monetized üí≤

Community

  • Terraform PDF Doc (‚≠ê64) üíÄ

Tools / Community providers

  • astro (‚≠ê436) - Astro is a tool for managing multiple Terraform executions as a single command. üëª
  • blast radius (‚≠ê2.1k) - Interactive visualizations of Terraform dependency graphs. üíÄ
  • json2hcl (‚≠ê518) - Convert JSON to HCL and vice versa. üëª
  • terraform-plan-parser (‚≠ê153) - Command line utility and JavaScript API for parsing stdout from terraform plan and converting it to JSON. üëª
  • tfjson (‚≠ê180) - Utility to read in a Terraform plan file and dump it out in JSON. üíÄ

entry.title: Awesome Terraform Updates on Jul 13 - Jul 19, 2020
entry.content:
Community

  • Terraform Bug Tracker (‚≠ê46k)
  • Terraform Community Modules
  • Terragrunt Reference Architecture (‚≠ê384)

Books

  • Getting Started with Terraform, 2nd ed.
  • Infrastructure as Code
  • Terraform in Action

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Beginner Guides

  • Using Terraform for Cloud Deployments - Part 1 - Provisioning an EC2 instance.

Tutorials and Blog Posts / How-To

  • Easily Deploy A Seneca Microservice to ECS with Wercker and Terraform: Part I, II & III - Illustrates how Terraform can be incorporated into a microservice deployment pipeline.
  • Zero Downtime Updates with HashiCorp Terraform - Ensuring zero downtime of your infrastructure.

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Multi-Environment Configuration

  • Terraform Design Patterns: the Terrafile - Managing Terraform modules and their versions within Terraform projects with Terrafile.
  • Terraform, VPC, and why you want a tfstate file per env - Some gotchas surrounding using Terraform in large projects with multiple environments and how to avoid them.
  • Using Pipelines to Manage Environments with Infrastructure as Code - Explains different approaches for building a pipeline to handle infrastructure changes moving from one environment to the next.

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Azure

  • New Terraform Azure Automation Resources - Azure Automation.
  • Terraforming Azure PaaS - Deploy PaaS Resources on Azure.

Tutorials and Blog Posts / Miscellaneous

  • The Segment AWS Stack - Shows the behind the scenes of the infrastructure powered by Terraform that solved The Million Dollar Engineering Problem at Segment.
  • Top 3 Terraform Testing Strategies for Ultra-Reliable Infrastructure-as-Code
  • Two Weeks with Terraform - Some hard-earned experience from using Terraform in the wild, and some operational wisdom.
  • Terraform: Beyond the Basics with AWS - Explanation of a demo using Terraform to provision a sample AWS architecture.
  • Terraform cost estimation (‚≠ê717) - Anonymized, secure, and free Terraform cost estimation based on Terraform plan (0.12+) or Terraform state (any version).

Community Modules / Miscellaneous

  • rancher-terraform-digitalocean (‚≠ê23) - Rancher server on digitalocean.
  • terraform-aws-autoscaling (‚≠ê304) - Creates Auto-Scaling Groups and Launch Configurations (verified module).
  • terraform-aws-ecr (‚≠ê189) - Manages Docker container registries on AWS ECR.
  • terraform-aws-efs (‚≠ê91) - Defines an EFS Filesystem.
  • terraform-aws-eks (‚≠ê4.7k) - Creates Elastic Kubernetes Service on AWS (very popular module).
  • terraform-aws-key-pair (‚≠ê151) - Automatically Generate SSH Key Pairs (Public/Private Keys).
  • terraform-aws-modules - Collection of Terraform AWS modules supported by the community (includes official AWS modules).
  • terraform-aws-postgresql-rds (‚≠ê85) - Creates PostgreSQL on RDS.
  • terraform-aws-secure-baseline (‚≠ê1.2k) - Set up your AWS account with the secure baseline configuration based on CIS Amazon Web Services Foundations.
  • terraform-aws-security-group (‚≠ê579) - Creates EC2-VPC security groups on AWS (verified module).
  • terraform-aws-ssh-bastion-service (‚≠ê208) - Terraform plan to deploy ssh bastion as a stateless service on AWS.
  • terraform-aws-vpc (‚≠ê3.1k) - Creates VPC resources on AWS (verified and very popular module).
  • terraform-azurerm-aks (‚≠ê0) - Create AKS resources on Azure.
  • terraform-azurerm-iis (‚≠ê6) - Install IIS Server on Azure VM instance.
  • terraform-azurerm-mysql (‚≠ê2) - Create MySql Database on Azure.
  • terraform-azurerm-redis (‚≠ê1) - Create Redis on Azure.
  • terraform-azurerm-sqlserver (‚≠ê8) - Create SQl Server Database on Azure.
  • terraform-ecs-jenkins (‚≠ê106) - Provisions Jenkins on AWS ECS using Terraform.
  • terraform-google-project-factory (‚≠ê896) - Opinionated Google Cloud Platform project creation and configuration with Shared VPC, IAM, APIs, etc.
  • terraform-static-website-s3-cloudfront (‚≠ê38) - Creates static websites on AWS S3 & Cloudfront based on variables.
  • tf_aws_bastion_s3_keys (‚≠ê190) - Creates bastion hosts on AWS EC2.

Self-Hosted Registries / Miscellaneous

  • anthology (‚≠ê135) - Private Terraform registry implementation as an alternative to the official registry.

Providers / Vendor supported providers

  • terraform-provider-healthchecksio (‚≠ê56) - Provider to manage healthchecks.io resources.
  • terraform-provider-keycloak (‚≠ê805) - Provider to manage the settings of your Keycloak identity provider server.
  • terraform-provider-stripe (‚≠ê243) - Provider for Stripe.
  • terraform-provider-uptimerobot (‚≠ê122) - Provider to manage uptimerobot resources.
  • terraform-provider-vaulted (‚≠ê38) - Encrypted HashiCorp Vault secrets via Terraform that can be stored in SCM such as Git.

Testing / Community providers

  • terratest (‚≠ê7.7k) - Terratest is a Go library that makes it easier to write automated tests for your infrastructure code.

Tools / Community providers

  • AirIAM (‚≠ê798) - AirIAM is a tool for AWS IAM to least privilege Terraform execution framework.
  • atlantis (‚≠ê8.4k) - Unified workflow for collaborating on Terraform through GitHub.
  • fogg (‚≠ê300) - A tool for eliminating toil in managing terraform repositories.
  • former2 (‚≠ê2.3k) - Generate terraform configuration from your existing resources within your AWS account.
  • iam-policy-json-to-terraform (‚≠ê794) - Small tool to convert an IAM Policy in JSON format into a Terraform aws_iam_policy_document
  • pre-commit-terraform (‚≠ê3.5k) - pre-commit git hooks to take care of Terraform configurations (auto-format, validate, update docs).
  • ruby-terraform (‚≠ê110) - Simple Ruby wrapper for invoking terraform commands.
  • scratchrelaxtv (‚≠ê31) - Simple Python tool to help with module development - extract vars from main.tf to generate variables.tf and make module usage stub from variables.tf.
  • tads-boilerplate (‚≠ê779) - The power of Ansible and Terraform + the simplicity of Docker Swarm = Infrastructure as Code and DevOps best practices.
  • terraboard (‚≠ê2k) - Web dashboard to inspect Terraform States.
  • terraboot (‚≠ê38) - DSL to generate a terraform configuration and run it.
  • terraform-provisioner (‚≠ê13) - Tool for managing multiple provisions of the same Terraform scripts.
  • terraform-rake-tasks (‚≠ê4) - Shared Rake tasks for managing terraform plans.
  • terrahelp (‚≠ê379) - Command line utility aimed at providing supplementary functionality which can sometimes prove useful when working with Terraform.
  • tfenv (‚≠ê4.7k) - Terraform version manager inspired by rbenv.
  • tfscaffold (‚≠ê277) - Framework for controlling multi-environment multi-component terraform-managed AWS infrastructure.
  • tfschema (‚≠ê306) - Schema inspector for Terraform providers.
  • tfupdate (‚≠ê606) - Update version constraints in your Terraform configurations.
  • tfwrapper (‚≠ê8) - Rubygem providing rake tasks for running Hashicorp Terraform sanely.

Libraries / IDE

  • pyhcl (‚≠ê339) - HCL parser in Python

Videos / IDE

  • Building Scalable, Repeatable Infrastructure in the Cloud with Terraform - Demonstrates how Terraform enables the practice of Infrastructure as Code by deploying TeamCity in AWS using a hosted PostgreSQL.
  • Creating a Google Compute Instance with Terraform - Example of creating a Google Compute Instance with Terraform code.
  • Creating a Terraform Provider for Just About Anything - Learn how to contribute to a Terraform provider or create your own from this walkthrough.
  • Evolving Your Infrastructure with Terraform - CTO of OpenCredo provides an extensive look at using Terraform in the real-world with the help of some interesting use-cases.
  • Going Multi-Cloud with Terraform and Nomad.
  • How to Extend the Terraform Provider List - In this talk, Paul will walk through the creation of a terraform provider.
  • Production ChaosMonkey with Terraform - How DigitalOcean uses Terraform to run production integration tests.
  • Running a Terraform Environment at Scale - Running Terraform at scale with hundreds of AWS accounts.
  • State of Terraform Providerland - How Terraform providers work and how to write one.
  • Terraform At Scale - How Segment uses Terraform.
  • Terraform w/ Lee Trout - Focuses on development patterns and how to effectively structure Terraform code.
  • Terraforming the Composable World - Integrating Terraform with an on-premise bare metal provisioning.
  • Untangling Terraform Through Refactoring - How to refactor your Terraform code in a careful way with minimum risk.

Editor Plugins / IDE

  • Terraform-lsp (‚≠ê587) (Language Server Protocol for Terraform)
  • Vim-Terraform-Completion (‚≠ê339)
entry.summary: 82 awesome projects updated on Jul 13 - Jul 19, 2020
